name: Daily Readings
author: Andrea Chiesa

sections.description:
You can display the readings either in a page and/or as a widget.

The widget is really useful as call to action in your homepage and other posts.

18 languages available: Arabic, German, Greek, English, Jewish, Italian, French, Spanish, Gaelic, Armenian, Korean, Malagasy, Dutch, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Turkish, Chinese.

11 main liturgical rites available: Roman, Ambrosian, Coptic, Maronite, Chaldean, Syriac, Melkite, Roman Extraordinary, Byzantine, Hellenic, Armenian.

TABLE OF AVAILABLE LANGUAGES AND RITES

Select a specific date from the calendar and display its readings.

Set your style, adapt this plugin to your website.

Versatile and easy to configure, customise it accordingly to your needs.

Third party as service
This plugin has been developed in collaboration with https://evangelizo.org/ as a service to retrieve the data to display on your website.
More specifically, the readings from the Bibles are retrieved through its feeds.

As reported in this Privacy Notice, no user data is stored in any way.
sections.faq:
Which liturgical rites does it support?

Roman, Ambrosian, Coptic, Maronite, Chaldean, Syriac, Melkite, Roman Extraordinary, Byzantine, Hellenic, Armenian.

Which languages are supported?

Arabic, German, Greek, English, Jewish, Italian, French, Spanish, Gaelic, Armenian, Korean, Malagasy, Dutch, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Turkish, Chinese.

Can I select a specific date from the calendar and display its readings?

Yes, you can click on the calendar icon and select a specific date. The page will refresh and you’ll be able to read the new readings.

sections.reviews:
Simple plugin that does exactly what it says it does.

By jhanten on February 2, 2023

If you want to post the liturgical readings on your website automatically this is a great way to do it. Just make sure your religious community is in the list of options and you are all set. Couldn't be easier.
